findings.title: Unprotected Transfer Function
findings.description: The 'transfer' function is declared as external and does not have any access modifiers, allowing unauthorized users to interact with it.

findings.title: Unprotected transferFrom Function
findings.description: The smart contract does not have a protected transferFrom function which can allow non-whitelisted wallets to interact with the contract.

findings.title: permit
findings.description: The permit function has a security issue marked with 🛑.

findings.title: Unprotected mint Function
findings.description: The mint function is marked as external and does not have any access modifiers, making it vulnerable to unauthorized access.

findings.title: burn
findings.description: External burn function with no further details provided.

findings.title: Unprotected Swap Function
findings.description: The swap function is declared as external and does not have any access modifiers, making it vulnerable to unauthorized calls.

findings.title: Skim
findings.description: The skim function has a security issue.

findings.title: Unprotected Sync Function
findings.description: The 'sync' function is not properly protected and can be accessed by anyone, potentially leading to unintended behavior.

findings.title: Unprotected Initialize Function
findings.description: The initialize function is declared as external and does not have any access modifiers, making it vulnerable to unauthorized calls.

findings.title: swapExactTokensForETHSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens
findings.description: The function swapExactTokensForETHSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens is vulnerable to fee-on-transfer tokens.

findings.title: swapExactTokensForTokensSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens
findings.description: The function swapExactTokensForTokensSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens is marked as external and does not have any additional information or warnings associated with it, suggesting a potential vulnerability.

findings.title: addLiquidityETH
findings.description: External function addLiquidityETH has been identified.
